intro: Hedyotis laceyi, commonly known as the lacey bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of up to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a delicate appearance. Hedyotis laceyi thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
